key_insight: Prune visual tokens using text (prompt) guidance so SAM2 only propagates tokens relevant to the target object across time, drastically reducing compute and memory while retaining segmentation quality.
problem_solved: SAM2 processes dense visual tokens for every frame and forwards them through expensive temporal reasoning modules, causing high computational and memory costs and poor scalability (quadratic growth across tokens/time).
method: Compute token relevance using the text prompt and score visual tokens for their importance to the target object.
Dynamically prune low-relevance tokens before temporal reasoning so only salient tokens are propagated across frames.
Integrate a lightweight, SAM2-compatible pruning stage to cut FLOPs/memory without substantially degrading segmentation accuracy.
impact: Enables practical, scalable deployment of SAM2 for prompt-driven video object segmentationâ€”reducing latency and hardware requirements so researchers and engineers can run larger or real-time workloads on constrained infrastructure.

paper_title: Fast SAM2 with Text-Driven Token Pruning
paper_authors: Avilasha Mandal, Chaoning Zhang, Fachrina Dewi Puspitasari, Xudong Wang, Jiaquan Zhang
